name: preserve
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyed

example.eg: We want to preserve the character of the town while improving the facilities.
example.egtrans: 我们想在改善市镇设施的同时保持其特色。

example.eg: The agreement preserved our right to limit trade in endangered species.
example.egtrans: 这项协议保留了我们限制濒危物种贸易的权利。

example.eg: Putting varnish on wood is a way of preserving it.
example.egtrans: 在木料上涂清漆是保护木料的一种方法。

example.eg: I need to get out of the house from time to time just to preserve (= prevent me from losing) my sanity.
example.egtrans: 我需要时不时到户外去以保持头脑清醒。

trans_examp.trans_en: to treat food in a particular way so that it can be kept for a long time without going bad

example.egtrans: 浸在白兰地中贮存的橙子

name: preserve
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: preserve
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a food made from fruit or vegetables boiled with sugar and water until it becomes a firm sauce

dsense.name: preserve
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an activity that only one person or a particular type of person does or is responsible for

example.eg: Owning racehorses is the preserve of the rich.
example.egtrans: 拥有赛马是富人的专利。

example.eg: Sport used to be a male preserve.
example.egtrans: 体育曾经是男性的专利。

dsense.name: preserve
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指野生动物）保护区（同 reserve）
